intro: Bidens triplinervia var. boyocana, commonly known as the Boyocan ironweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and wetlands. Its leaves are usually serrated and have a distinctive triplinervous venation pattern. The showy yellow flowers appear in clusters and bloom during the warmer months, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
